sub_title: Research Analyst & Human Rights and Programme Advisor | Human Rights, Humanitarian Law,  Conflict Analysis and Gender | Research and Capacity Building Specialist | Skilled trainer and facilitator.
summary:
Researcher & Human Rights Programming Advisor with ample experience in strategy advice and building organisations’ and individuals’ capacities in human rights monitoring, safety & security, rule of law, advocacy, gender & gender mainstreaming, programme design and programme development (conflict & post-conflict settings). 

I am passionate about strengthening human rights and humanitarian programming - outcome, impact, evaluation and learning - and do so by connecting, engaging and empowering people across different disciplines and cultural backgrounds.  Able to guide and coach towards making effective decisions. Analytically strong, skilled facilitator -with a good sense of humour- and excellent presentation and writing skills.  

Specific expertise in (investigating) sexual violence, torture, refugee and IDP rights, safety & security of working in insecure environments, and in human rights investigation/field research-techniques in general.

education.field_of_study: Development studies; Africa, refugees, International Aid

school.name: Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC)/Danish Refugee Council (DRC), Copenhagen, Denmark.

authors.headline: Research Analyst & Human Rights and Programme Advisor | Human Rights, Humanitarian Law,  Conflict Analysis and Gender | Research and Capacity Building Specialist | Skilled trainer and facilitator.

profile_positions.description:
Human Rights Adviser with the European Union Capacity Building Mission in Somalia. Responsible for mainstreaming human rights and due diligence good practices throughout all the Mission's activities and Field Offices. Ensured mainstreaming of an essential and achievable human rights focus in the current Mission Implementation Plan, MIP, (2023-2024). 

Internal and external training of Mission Advisers and Somali (Maritime and non-Maritime) Security Actors on human rights-based policing, inluding human rights responsibilities related to e.g, Key Principles on the Use of Force, Arrest and Detention, Search and Rescue, Ethical Standards, Evidence-based Investigations, Prevention and Response to SGBV. 
Carried out a Due Diligence risk assessment on the security sector & actors in Puntland and Bosasso. 

Provided advise to Mission Senior Management on human rights related and due diligence concerns. 
Developed the practical Human Rights Curriulum for the Somali Police Force (SPF) new recruits. 
Developed the Mission's Human Rights-based policing Trainer's Guide, used Mission-wide, tangible and scenario-based. 

Coordinated with International Actors (including UN, EU Delegation, EUTM) to ensure an integrated approach on human rights due diligence and advise on human rights and security trends where possible.
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Adviser

profile_positions.location: Based in Amsterdam, (operational abroad: East Africa, West Africa & the MENA)
profile_positions.description:
Coordinated the Monitoring, Documenting and Reporting (MDR) capacity building Programme, aimed at strengthening the human rights monitoring and  investigation capacity of (local, regional) partner organisations, institutions and  Amnesty colleagues.  Main focus on programme development and learning, data collection, analysis and evaluation. 
Developed tailor made (training and learning) materials, training partner organisations in creating and guiding teams of human rights monitors through field investigations. 

Solid expertise in the field of capacity-building with partner organizations in Africa and the Middle East, in human rights monitoring, humanitarian law, strategy development, impact and output measurement.   

Creative trainer; developed modules in specific human rights areas (a.o. investigating sexual violence, torture & ill treatment), and in the practical application of International Human Rights Law and International Humanitarian Law (Beginner and Advanced levels). 

Trained and coached human rights organizations -as well as AI teams- on (specifics of) conducting investigations, research methodology,  interviewing, safety and security management, analysis of patterns, conflict analysis. 

Coordinated and trained local defenders within the South Sudan Programme which resulted in the first joint Amnesty International/local human rights defenders’ report on Sexual Violence: ‘Do Not Remain Silent. Survivors of Sexual Violence in South Sudan call for Justice and Reparations’.  
https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/afr65/6469/2017/en/
profile_positions.title: Senior Programme Officer at AI Netherlands (Human Rights Capacity Building Programme - HURICAP)

profile_positions.location: Oslo - Norway/ Tincomalee, Batticaloa - Sri Lanka
profile_positions.description: Technical Support Department, Oslo. Revision of the ‘Camp Management Toolkit’; co-author of the Second Edition, including providing technical support to Sri Lankan government officials & Red Cross in areas of Camp Management, protection and coordination in Tsunami affected areas of Eastern Sri Lanka (Trincomalee & Batticaloa).
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Protection adviser/trainer of NRCs Sub Office in Nyala, South Darfur in support of camp management & site design. Set-up NRC’s office in Nyala, including staff employ- and deployment in South Dar-fur in support of the IDP population of Kalma Camp.
Deployed, supervised and trained teams of local (IDP) staff (+/- 70) in camp protection, interviewing methodology, registration procedures and monitoring assistance delivery.  Demonstrated improvement of timely identification of the most vulnera-ble, camp security assessment, and coordination of humanitarian assistance.  
Training of Sudanese authorities and law enforcement on rights of refugees and IDPs. Coordination of emergency aid and activities of implementing NGOs and spokesperson for the NRC for international media.
profile_positions.title: Trainer, Protection Advisor

profile_positions.description: Developed and led an interagency consultation process in Sierra Leone (country-wide).  Interviewed some 50 humanitarian actors in Sierra Leone operating in the areas of camp management and refugee/IDP protection.  Aim was to collect information as well as actor's views on best (and worst) practices of (IDP/Refugee) camp management, which included all relevant and practical tools, guidelines and reference material . This was done in preparation of the development of an Interagency Toolkit on Camp Management.   (Co-author and editor of substantial parts of the Toolkit - Field Testing Prototype, First Edition, Norway).
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Due to the election violence and tensions in Cote d'Ivoire, UNHCR Ghana anticipated a large refugee influx from its neighbour.  In close collaboration with the Ghanaian government an Emergency Taskforce was established of which I had a coordinating role representing the UNHCR. This included site identification, situation monitoring, consultation and engagement with local communities and traditional leaders on suitable locations for possible camp establishments.   

Developed reception and registration procedures including revising border monitoring policies with Ghanaian Immigration Services.  In addition, I trained Immigration Services and border security forces on refugee protection and registration procedures at various border crossings.
profile_positions.title: Protection Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The Humanitarian Accountability Project (HAP)  - (now CHS Alliance) started in December 2001 with its first field trial of accountability mechanisms by non-governmental, inter-governmental or governmental agencies assisting refugee & IDP populations in Sierra Leone. 

As the methodology officer in a team of three, I developed the research framework to monitor and assess  existing accountability mechanisms and response/complaint mechanisms of Sierra Leonean IDPs, returnees and Liberian refugees. This involved ao interviewing (open, semi-structured), focus group discussions, observation (during distribution). 

Following the field assessment, we advocated and with humanitarian actors in addressing challenges in communication, transparency and accountability encountered. As a result, several humanitarian actors adopted changes in communication and monitoring procedures related to their IDP/refugee assistance.
profile_positions.title: Research/Methodology Officer

profile_positions.description: Collected first hand evidence and reported on human rights abuses by all parties in the Sierra Leonean conflict. Liaised with the national and international community, including media, UN and various agencies in systematically providing updated key information on attacks, victims, alleged perpetrators, rebel movements and security developments.  Maintained a protected database of testimonies from witnesses, victims, survivors and perpetrators.  Liaised with the Special Court for Sierra Leone (SCSL) on findings in relation to persons of interest to the Court. Contributed in research and writing to press releases and human rights reports. Carried out several investigative missions to Guinea and Côte d’Ivoire. Making recommendations to the UN, the Sierra Leonean Government,  Foreign Governments, National and INGOs.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Researcher (Sierra Leone, Cote d'Ivoire, Guinea)
